sen.j: 晴季は豊臣秀吉と親密な間柄で、織田信長亡き後、秀吉が天下人として、征夷大将軍の位を得ようとし、足利義昭の猶子となろうと工作したものの、義昭の拒否に遭い、将軍職を諦めていた所に関白任官を持ちかけ、朝廷における斡旋、調停役を務めた。
sen.e: Following the death of Nobunaga ODA, Harusue, enjoying a close friendship with Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, at that time in power, attempted to attain the position of seii taishogun through positioning himself as the adopted son of Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, yet was rejected by Yoshiaki, and when at the point of abandoning the shogunate it was suggested he become the kanpaku (Chief Advisor tothe Emperor) and worked in the Imperial Court in mediation and arbitration.

Following the death of Nobunaga ODA, Harusue, enjoying a close friendship with Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, in power at that time, attempted to attain the position of seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") through positioning himself as the adopted son of Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, yet was rejected by Yoshiaki, and when at the point of abandoning the shogunate it was suggested he become the kanpaku (Chief Advisor to the Emperor) and subsequently he worked in the Imperial Court in mediation and arbitration.

sen.j: これにより晴季は朝廷内で重きをなしたが、秀吉の甥で養子の関白豊臣秀次に娘を嫁がせていたため、文禄4年（1595年）8月に秀次が謀反の疑いを懸けられ高野山で自害を強いられ、秀次の一族妻妾が殺されると、これに連座し、越後国に流罪となり失脚した。
sen.e: From this time Harusue began attaining power within the Imperial Court yet as the adopted son of Hideyoshi, he took as wife the adopted daughter of kanpaku Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, who in August of 1595 was forced to commit suicide on Koya-san Mountain over the suspicion of his fomenting rebellion, with his relatives, wife and mistress being killed and through this connection Harusue was forced to step down from his appointed office and was banished to Echigo.

Koya over suspicion of his fomenting rebellion, with his relatives, wife, and mistress being killed, and through this connection Harusue was forced to step down from his appointed office and was banished to Echigo Province.
